trans-unit.source: Exposes a data item in an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection to UI Automation.

Data items that are not also <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> types do not have children; however, they can have a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree and a corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree.
For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> can have a collection of strings that contain data items.
When those items are processed by an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> for visualization, a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree is created for them.
This tree can have a corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree.

After the tree is created, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] merges the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree into a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree.

<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer> works with its <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> counterpart, if it exists, to obtain more information about the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree.
Only visible data items, or more precisely, the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> trees, have this dualism.
Non-visible data items, which have no corresponding <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> trees, have only one <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
Provides initialization for base class values when called by the constructor of a derived class.
The data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> that holds the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.

Gets the accelerator key for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey%2A>.
The accelerator key.

Gets the access key for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey%2A>.
The access key.

Gets the string that uniquely identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
The value of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property is not set, the value is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId%2A>.
A string that contains the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] identifier.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the bounding rectangle of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle%2A>.
The bounding rectangle.

Gets the collection of child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren%2A>.
The collection of child elements.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that represents the clickable space that is on the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint%2A>.
The point that represents the clickable space that is on the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.

Gets the string that describes the functionality of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText%2A>.
The help text.
Gets a string that conveys the visual status of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus%2A>.
The status.
Examples include "Busy" or "Online".
Gets a human-readable string that contains the type of item that the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> represents.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType%2A>.
The item type.
An example includes "Mail Message" or "Contact".

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Label"></xref> that is targeted to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer"></xref> for the element that is targeted by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Label"></xref>.

Gets the text label of the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
You can think of the name property as if it were a string of text that users use to explain which control they are referring to.

Make certain that you have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName%2A>.
The text label.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> is laid out in a particular direction.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation%2A>.
The direction of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.

Optionally, the method returns <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation.None"></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> is not laid out in a particular direction.
Returns the object that supports the specified control pattern of the element that is associated with this automation peer.
If `patternInterface` is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName> and the item is not in the visual tree, this method returns a `this` pointer.

If `patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName>, this method returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISynchronizedInputProvider> interface.
An enumeration value that specifies the control pattern.
An object that supports the control pattern if patternInterface is a supported value; otherwise, `null`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> currently has keyboard input focus.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus%2A>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> has keyboard input focus; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> contains data that is presented to the user.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement%2A>.
`true` if the element is a content element; otherwise, `false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref> is understood by the end user as interactive.
The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection.
The user might understand the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)].
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement%2A>.
`true` if the element is a control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> can receive and send events.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsEnabled%2A>.
`true` if the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peer can receive and send events; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> can accept keyboard focus.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable%2A>.
`true` if the element can accept keyboard focus; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> is off the screen.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen%2A>.
This method does not indicate whether the element is visible.
In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible.
For example, if the element is obscured by other elements, it might not be visible.
In this case, the method returns `false`.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> is not on the screen; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> contains protected content.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword%2A>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> contains protected content; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> is required to be completed on a form.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm%2A>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> is required to be completed; otherwise, `false`.

Gets the data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
The data item.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> that holds the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> object.
Sets the keyboard input focus on the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> corresponds to the data item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus%2A>.
Makes the virtual item fully accessible as a UI Automation element.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider> interface.
